simplesect.para: The id of the active screen
The current active Window or NULL if there is no active client.

parameterdescription.para: The client which is starting point to find the next client

simplesect.para: The next Window in focus chain

detaileddescription.para: This method is used by the ClientModel to find an entrance into the focus chain in case there is no active Client.

simplesect.para: The first Client of the focus chain

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether the given client is part of the focus chain at all. This is useful to figure out whether the currently active Client can be used as a starting point to construct the recently used list.
In case the client is not in the focus chain it is recommended to use the Client returned by firstClientFocusChain.

The method accepts a null Client and in that case false is returned.
client
The Client to check whether it is in the Focus Chain
true in case the Client is part of the focus chain, false otherwise.
4.9.2

parameterdescription.para: The client whose desktop name should be retrieved

simplesect.para: The desktop name of the given Window. If the client is on all desktops the name of current desktop will be returned.

detaileddescription.para: whether KWin is currently compositing and it's related features (elevating) can be used
De-/Elevate a client using the compositor (if enabled)

parameterdescription.para: The client the other one will be placed below

detaileddescription.para:
Toggle between ShadeHover and ShadeNormal - not shaded windows are unaffected
c
The client to be shaded
b
Whether to un- or shade

simplesect.para: The current stacking order of Windows

detaileddescription.para:
Determines if given client will be added to the list:
if the client wants to have tab focus.
The client won't be added if it has modal dialogs
In that case the modal dialog will be returned if it isn't already included
Won't be added if it isn't on active screen when using separate screen focus
client
The client to be checked for inclusion
allDesktops
Add clients from all desktops or only from current
The client to be included in the list or NULL if it isn't to be included

simplesect.para: The first desktop window in the stacking order.

detaileddescription.para: Activates the currently selected client and closes the TabBox.

Call this method when you want to change the currently used TabBoxConfig. It fires the signal configChanged.
config
Updates the currently used TabBoxConfig to config

Call this method to show the TabBoxView. Depending on current configuration this method might not do anything. If highlight windows effect is to be used it will be activated.
TabBoxConfig::isShowTabBox
TabBoxConfig::isHighlightWindows

Hides the TabBoxView if shown. Deactivates highlight windows effect if active.
show

Sets the current model index in the view and updates highlight windows if active.
index
The current Model index

Retrieves the next or previous item of the current item.
forward
next or previous item
The next or previous item. If there is no matching item the current item will be returned.

Initializes the model based on the current config. This method has to be invoked before showing the TabBox. It can also be invoked when clients are added or removed. In that case partialReset has to be true.

parameterdescription.para: Keep the currently selected item or regenerate everything

detaileddescription.para:
Handles additional grabbed key events by the TabBox controller.
event
The key event which has been grabbed

parameterdescription.para: The position to be tested in global coordinates

simplesect.para: True if the view contains the point, otherwise false.

parameterdescription.para: The Window whose index should be returned

simplesect.para: Returns the ModelIndex of given Window or an invalid ModelIndex if the model does not contain the given Window.
Returns the current list of Windows.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the client to be returned

simplesect.para: Returns the Window at given model index. If the index is invalid, does not point to a Client or the list is empty, NULL will be returned.
The first model index. That is the model index at position 0, 0. It is valid, as desktop has at least one desktop and if there are no clients an empty item is created.
whether the TabBox operates in a no modifier grab mode. In this mode a click on an item should directly accept and close the tabbox.

detaileddescription.para:
This signal is fired when the TabBoxConfig changes
setConfig
This class is a wrapper around KWin Workspace. It is used for accessing the required core methods from inside TabBox and has to be implemented in KWin core.
